description: Gets the label detection results of a Amazon Rekognition Video analysis started by  StartLabelDetection. The label detection operation is started by a call to  StartLabelDetection which returns a job identifier ( JobId). When the label detection operation finishes, Amazon Rekognition publishes a completion status to the Amazon Simple Notification Service topic registered in the initial call to StartlabelDetection. To get the results of the label detection operation, first check that the status value published to the Amazon SNS topic is SUCCEEDED. If so, call  GetLabelDetection and pass the job identifier ( JobId) from the initial call to StartLabelDetection. GetLabelDetection returns an array of detected labels ( Labels) sorted by the time the labels were detected. You can also sort by the label name by specifying NAME for the SortBy input parameter. If there is no NAME specified, the default sort is by timestamp. You can select how results are aggregated by using the AggregateBy input parameter. The default aggregation method is TIMESTAMPS. You can also aggregate by SEGMENTS, which aggregates all instances of labels detected in a given segment. The returned Labels array may include the following attributes: Timestamp and Bounding box information are returned for detected Instances, only if aggregation is done by TIMESTAMPS. If aggregating by SEGMENTS, information about detected instances isn't returned. The version of the label model used for the detection is also returned. Note DominantColors isn't returned for Instances, although it is shown as part of the response in the sample seen below. Use MaxResults parameter to limit the number of labels returned. If there are more results than specified in MaxResults, the value of NextToken in the operation response contains a pagination token for getting the next set of results. To get the next page of results, call GetlabelDetection and populate the NextToken request parameter with the token value returned from the previous call to GetLabelDetection. If you are retrieving results while using the Amazon Simple Notification Service, note that you will receive an 'ERROR' notification if the job encounters an issue.

parameters.name: JobId
parameters.description: Job identifier for the label detection operation for which you want results returned. You get the job identifer from an initial call to StartlabelDetection.

nested_items.name: JobStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the label detection job.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: If the job fails, StatusMessage provides a descriptive error message.

nested_items.name: VideoMetadata
nested_items.description: Information about a video that Amazon Rekognition Video analyzed. Videometadata is returned in every page of paginated responses from a Amazon Rekognition video operation.

nested_items.name: Codec
nested_items.description: Type of compression used in the analyzed video.

nested_items.name: DurationMillis
nested_items.description: Length of the video in milliseconds.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: Format of the analyzed video. Possible values are MP4, MOV and AVI.

nested_items.name: FrameRate
nested_items.description: Number of frames per second in the video.

nested_items.name: FrameHeight
nested_items.description: Vertical pixel dimension of the video.

nested_items.name: FrameWidth
nested_items.description: Horizontal pixel dimension of the video.

nested_items.name: ColorRange
nested_items.description: A description of the range of luminance values in a video, either LIMITED (16 to 235) or FULL (0 to 255).

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If the response is truncated, Amazon Rekognition Video returns this token that you can use in the subsequent request to retrieve the next set of labels.

nested_items.name: Labels
nested_items.description: An array of labels detected in the video. Each element contains the detected label and the time, in milliseconds from the start of the video, that the label was detected.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: Time, in milliseconds from the start of the video, that the label was detected. Note that Timestamp is not guaranteed to be accurate to the individual frame where the label first appears.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name (label) of the object or scene.

nested_items.name: Confidence
nested_items.description: Level of confidence.

nested_items.name: Instances
nested_items.description: If Label represents an object, Instances contains the bounding boxes for each instance of the detected object. Bounding boxes are returned for common object labels such as people, cars, furniture, apparel or pets.

nested_items.name: BoundingBox
nested_items.description: The position of the label instance on the image.

nested_items.name: Width
nested_items.description: Width of the bounding box as a ratio of the overall image width.

nested_items.name: Height
nested_items.description: Height of the bounding box as a ratio of the overall image height.

nested_items.name: Left
nested_items.description: Left coordinate of the bounding box as a ratio of overall image width.

nested_items.name: Top
nested_items.description: Top coordinate of the bounding box as a ratio of overall image height.

nested_items.name: Confidence
nested_items.description: The confidence that Amazon Rekognition has in the accuracy of the bounding box.

nested_items.name: DominantColors
nested_items.description: The dominant colors found in an individual instance of a label.

nested_items.name: Red
nested_items.description: The Red RGB value for a dominant color.

nested_items.name: Blue
nested_items.description: The Blue RGB value for a dominant color.

nested_items.name: Green
nested_items.description: The Green RGB value for a dominant color.

nested_items.name: HexCode
nested_items.description: The Hex code equivalent of the RGB values for a dominant color.

nested_items.name: CSSColor
nested_items.description: The CSS color name of a dominant color.

nested_items.name: SimplifiedColor
nested_items.description: One of 12 simplified color names applied to a dominant color.

nested_items.name: PixelPercent
nested_items.description: The percentage of image pixels that have a given dominant color.

nested_items.name: Parents
nested_items.description: The parent labels for a label. The response includes all ancestor labels.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the parent label.

nested_items.name: Aliases
nested_items.description: A list of potential aliases for a given label.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of an alias for a given label.

nested_items.name: Categories
nested_items.description: A list of the categories associated with a given label.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of a category that applies to a given label.

nested_items.name: StartTimestampMillis
nested_items.description: The time in milliseconds defining the start of the timeline segment containing a continuously detected label.

nested_items.name: EndTimestampMillis
nested_items.description: The time in milliseconds defining the end of the timeline segment containing a continuously detected label.

nested_items.name: DurationMillis
nested_items.description: The time duration of a segment in milliseconds, I.e. time elapsed from StartTimestampMillis to EndTimestampMillis.

nested_items.name: LabelModelVersion
nested_items.description: Version number of the label detection model that was used to detect labels.

nested_items.name: JobId
nested_items.description: Job identifier for the label detection operation for which you want to obtain results. The job identifer is returned by an initial call to StartLabelDetection.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: Name of the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: S3 object key name.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: If the bucket is versioning enabled, you can specify the object version.

nested_items.name: JobTag
nested_items.description: A job identifier specified in the call to StartLabelDetection and returned in the job completion notification sent to your Amazon Simple Notification Service topic.

nested_items.name: GetRequestMetadata
nested_items.description: Information about the paramters used when getting a response. Includes information on aggregation and sorting methods.

nested_items.name: SortBy
nested_items.description: The sorting method chosen for a GetLabelDetection request.

nested_items.name: AggregateBy
nested_items.description: The aggregation method chosen for a GetLabelDetection request.
